newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia PM says World Bank loan delay wrong policy.
newsitem.headline: Croatia PM says World Bank loan delay wrong policy.

text.p: Croatian Prime Minister Zlatko Matesa on Wednesday criticised a World Bank decision, made after a request from the United States, to delay a $30 million loan to Croatia.

Matesa said he believed the World Bank was being used for political means in the affair. "To be very honest, I think that it is a totally wrong policy," he told Reuters at an international conference on transition economies.

"We are talking about a loan. It is something which by definition has to be paid back. It is not a gift and I do not think the World Bank is an institution which (should) be used for political means," Matesa said.
Asked if he believed the bank was being used for political means in this case, Matesa answered: "Absolutely".
A World Bank press officer said in Washington on Tuesday that the discussion had been postponed at the request of the international organisation's U.S. executive director.

A U.S. official said on Monday Washington was asking the World Bank to postpone the release of the loan because Zagreb had not followed through on commitments on extraditing suspected war criminals made under the Dayton peace accord.
